page.title: 04Changes in Whitminster.
page.content:
Mrs Pocket has lived in Whitminster since 1931. With her son she owns Parklands Farm. She told us how her life had changed since the war.
Modern conveniences such as electricity did not arrive in the village until 1955. Piped water was also rare. Before that arrived Mrs Pocket got her water from a pump in the kitchen by pulling a handle and filling up big tubs. This made the washing very hard work, it took all morning, so it was only done once a week.
The farm had no modern equipment which meant that all milking had to be done by hand. The farm had beef calves and about forty dairy cattle.
